data.title: Tasty is the word here.
data.text:
We've eaten at most of the good places in downtown Mesa and driving by my wife said lets eat here. 
     We walked in a realized they are still renovating some of the place and it is coming along nicely.
     Walking in we also noticed the smell of some wonderful food. 
     They brought out salsa and chips. It looked normal, but wasn't in anyway. It was fill of flavor and had just the right amount of kick.
     We ordered the Guac and was pleasantly surprised at how fresh it was and so flavorful.
     I had the Mole de Pollo and my wife ordered the Cheese Enchilada and a Green Chili Burro in Red Sauce.
     Mine was very good though the Chicken could have been chunkier. It was so very good. Their beans are almost as good as my moms.
     My wife's plate was huge and she devoured half and took the rest home. It's not often she comments on how good the red sauce it at most places. This one she really enjoyed.
     If you don't mind the sparse walls, you will love the food.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: Have eaten here twice (I am new to the AZ). The food and service has always been great. I had the quesadilla appetizer and it was a meal. Brought half of it home (there were 6 huge pieces). I have also had just chips and the queso dip. OMG, that was amazing! The happy hour margarita was just ok. The servers have always been friendly and helpful. I will go back!

data.title: Great food, friendly staff.
data.text: Finally got here early enough before a concert to get in and we were impressed. The staff was friendly and helpful.  Chips were warm and crispy, loved the blended salsa. I had the Cadillac margarita which was good but pricy. The shrimp relleno was perfect and my partner enjoyed her shrimp enchiladas. We will definitely come again next time we're in Mesa for a show.

data.title: Terrible Mexican food--- so disappointed
data.text: Several of us went for lunch and maybe they are not set up for lunch groups. We have not been there for dinner and probably will not return. There was a bug frozen into one of the ice cubes in my drink. I ordered a salad and when it came I asked if it was a salad since there was no lettuce visible. Basically it was three small pieces of lettuce on a plate with about 1/4 c of small kibble sized pieces of a mystery meat on top (I thought I had ordered beef.) In hindsight, I wish I would have taken a photo of it!  I used the chips salsa for dressing. Several people said they were disappointed with their lunches, but maybe the night time menu and service is better? Also, be sure to ask for the Margarita prices before ordering one!

data.title: Great Mexican Food near Mesa Arts Center
data.text: A short walk from the Mesa Arts Center, Margarita’s Grill is the perfect location to have a drink or a bite to eat before the show. We had only 1 hour, and the service was friendly & efficient; they are obviously accustomed to dealing with patrons in a hurry. The food, Chicken Fajitas & Relleno Pollo, was fresh & portions were generous. The Rosarita Margarita was a perfect drink option. If you have tickets to the latest show at Mesa Arts Center, Margarita’s Grill is a great place for a drink or dinner.

data.title: Try it again
data.text: When the familiar places, Blue Adobe Grill and Mango's were packed, we tried Margaritas Grill. It became packed as the evening got closer to that evening's MAC performance time. Reasonably average food all around as our waiter accommodated our few special requests. We will come back to try other dishes. Comfortable atmosphere and seating not as crowded as Mangos!!

data.title: Great find!
data.text: We stopped in for a snack and we were very happy we did.  The waitress was very friendly and the food was good and the happy hour prices were good.  The margaritas were excellent!  I would recommend the Margaritas Grille.

data.title: Loved it!!
data.text:
Welcomed warmly and given a nice table in the window. Margaritas were delicious, fussy me got a made to order with lime juice and no mix. 
Shrimp enchiladas with verde sauce were the hit of the 2 meals ordered. So good! Served with black beans and rice. Home made guac was freshly made and a garlicky delight. Salsa was also fresh and delicious. Would eat here again. Waiter was charming and quick.

data.title: JUST SAT ON PATIO - POOR SERVICE & POOR FOOD
data.text: I just took a group of people to this restaurant after an event at MAC. We decided to sit on the patio.  First of all, it took over 10 minutes before we ever saw anybody.  Then when the waiter arrived he brought one basket of chips before wiping down the table (which was pretty dirty).  He then came back about 10 minutes later and took our drink order.  Our drinks took about 10 - 15 minutes to come.  We then waited 20 minutes to take our food order (we had to ask!).  Two of us ordered a cheese crisp.  Now you would expect a cheese crisp to be "crispy".  I guess not at Margaritas, it was like a doughy tortilla with barely melted cheese and some chicken.  It was pretty pitiful.  Again, another 15 minutes for a drink refill. Wow after over 30 minutes from the food being delivered a waitress brought some salsa.  One of my friends (being somewhat agitated asked for a to go box for the salsa).  The waitress came back with a huge togo box for the salsa.  I don't know what is going on there, but stay away until they make some changes.

data.title: Finally good food near the MAC
data.text: My be I never noticed this place before but we have been there 2 nights in a row now. Wow!  The margharita are exellent and we are picky .  The fajitas were delish and the quacamole was fresh. We especially appreciated the excellent service from Sandra who was darling with a big smile. I even forgot my iPad there and they held it for me till the next night.  Highly recomended this place.

data.title: Surprised there is little business after performances at Mesa art center
data.text: Found the place nearly empty after a wonderful performance at Mesa Art Center right across the street so that made us nervous.  We ordered a shrimp quesadilla and guac.  Guac was well made but would have been tastier with warm taco chips, same goes for enjoying chips with the salsa.  Also had a small order of fried shrimp which were very tasty with a raspberry chipolte sauce.  Best part of evening was Nate the bartender who has a wonderful repartee and can easily remind you physically of Darius from Hootie & the Blowfish.  Other bar patrons made it a fun evening despite the staff being ready for us all to leave as they prefer to close at 10pm.  Margaritas are tasty.

data.title: Refreshing on all counts
data.text: Margaritas Grille was exactly as we hoped from reading other reviews.  Small, cozy, and absolutely adds to the updating of downtown Mesa.  Our server, Sandra, was most attentive and courteous.  Our entrees included the shrimp enchiladas and fish tacos.  Fresh ingredients and just the right amount of spicy!Extremely reasonable prices.  Highly recommend reservations, especially if enjoying an event at the Arts Center within five minutes walking distance of the establishment.

data.title: Before the play
data.text: We dined here before a play. The food was OK. I did try something that I had not eaten before and was pleased with it. My wife's food was average. The staff was great!

data.title: Cozy Mexican restaurant
data.text:
My Wife and I met 3 other couples here during happy hour.
The waited kept our glasses/bottles full. The give complementary chips/salsa. They have a full menu and from the other couples, they serve delicious food! We were out on the patio, the restaurant was getting full, they have a nice bar. This was a nice setting, the city of Mesa has been working hard at modernizing the city and it shows, nice modern art structures around the streets, Metro-light rail goes by the restaurant every 15-20 minutes. People walking the streets shopping! it was a lot of fun! As with its name, this place specializes in Margaritas but has a good variety of drinks/beer.

data.title: Pretty Good Mexican Food
data.text: The margaritas were just OK.  Good ambiance.  Food was fresh & tasty.  I had the pollo asada tacos that were light with an abundance of flavor.  My spouse had shrimp enchiladas that were delicious.

data.title: Good food at good prices
data.text: We stopped in on a Friday afternoon and took advantage of happy hour pricing on chicken-stuffed quesadilla and margarita on the rocks. The regular dinner menu is a good value as well, and the hubby had a combo plate of taco, enchilada, and tostada. The waiter was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere was welcoming. We enjoyed our meal a lot.

data.title: Need to come back
data.text: I visited this location when it was the de la Cruz Bistro. Definitely more casual now. Went in on a rainy evening, there were more servers than guests. Happy Hour specials were fine if you like domestic beer, and I honestly didn't see a cheap price for the appetizers we ordered. Will have to return and try their regular menu, but not in any hurry, as I wasn't truly impressed.

data.title: Great service, a good meal for my husband but tougher to suit me
data.text: My husband and I chose Margaritas Grill for dinner before a show at the Mesa Arts Center. We had a mixed experience. My husband was really pleased with his Cadillac Margarita and Shrimp Chile Relleno, which is the basis for my favorable rating. I knew my meal would be a challenge since I can't have aged cheese, beans or citrus (migraine triggers for me), so all Mexican food is problematic for me. I do like shrimp so the waiter suggested shrimp tacos. When my tacos came, I was disappointed to find them drenched in hot sauce. Since I've not had much Mexican food in many years, I'm not used to the hot sauce and don't really enjoy the mouth on fire feeling it gives. In fact, the burning sensation was so intense, I couldn't really taste anything else. For what it's worth, I think there were a total of 4 shrimp on the two tacos, two apiece. That may be normal for shrimp tacos, but it was disappointing to me. I got only rice as a side (no beans, right), and that seemed flavorless too, barely pinkish, not much but white rice there. Our server Alex was very nice and attentive, but I chose not to talk to him about the taco hot sauce. I imagine he would have offered a redo without the hot sauce, and since I didn't ask, I can't really hold that against the restaurant. I was still hungry when I finished picking through the tacos so I ordered the flan, which was fine and filling. It was quiet when we went since we chose to go early on a Saturday night so service was excellent, and we could talk easily. Given my limitations, I don't know that we will try them again. I'd say it was just not a good idea for us to choose a Mexican restaurant given my limitations. The alternative near the Arts Center was Thai, which is also problematic for me. The rating reflects my husband's opinion of his meal.

data.title: Great atmosphere, friendly service, good food!
data.text: Came here for the first time for a business lunch. Service was timely and friendly, drinks were always full. My party had carne asada tacos, shrimp tacos, and chicken enchiladas. All was great, ingredients seemed fresh. Bill for three people was $35.

data.title: one good thing, the salsa was excellent
data.text: The food was slow in coming to the table, the wine list really needs some tweaking, but, our server was so helpful and understanding............
